title: Trump news - live: Impeachment looms after president admits pressuring foreign leader to investigate his main 2020 opponent
text:
US President Donald Trump is heading to New York for the United Nation's General Assembly where he will host the Global Call to Protect Religious Freedom event. He is also scheduled to have a number of bilateral meetings with world leaders, including Egyptian President Abdul Fattah el-Sisi, Prime Minister of New Zealand Jacinda Arden and Pakistan's president Arif Alvi.

Back at home, Congress is under increasing pressure to remove him as president following allegations that he tried to damage Joe Biden’s 2020 campaign with the help of the Ukrainians.

Mr Trump admitted on Sunday that he raised Mr Biden in a conversation with Ukraine's leader about corruption, but his secretary of state Mike Pompeo is insisting that the president did not apply pressure on Volodymyr Zelensky to investigate his political rival's son.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

A series of leading Democrats have said the scandal is so serious it demands the ultimate sanction of impeachment.

Key Points Donald Trump is heading to New York for the United Nation's General Assembly

Congress is under increasing pressure to remove him as president

Trump admits he talked about Joe Biden with Ukraine's leader
